Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life)

result.execSummary:
The defendant James D. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Obtain HSED, GED or it's equivalent.  Seek and maintain employment commensurate with his treatment and counseling needs.  Agent to determine how much is appropriate.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a alcohol assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with co-defendant and victims in 14CF231.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Credit for 242 days.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Hammer.  Court reviewed PSI and sentencing memo from defense.  No changes or corrections noted by either party.  

State recommends 14CF220 probation 2 years.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. seek and maintain employment.  Obtain HSED or GED.   On case number 14CF231.  State recommends maximum probation.  1 year conditional jail.  Credit for time served.  242 days.    Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with victims or co-defendants.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Random UA's.  Seek and maintain employment. 

Court questions read-in from La Crosse County mentioned in the PSI.  Attorney Hammer will proceed with sentencing here today and deal with La Crosse County cases separately.  Court confirms with the defendant that those charges are not going to be addressed today.  Defendant wishes to proceed with the Jackson County cases today.  He understands the La Crosse County cases will not be resolved today.  State confirms to the court that victim notification has been complied with.  

Defense files a letter from the defendant with the court.  Defense recommends probation.  Huber, and EMP requested for the conditional jail.  Defendant does not wish to add anything to the hand written letter filed with the court.  Defendant's father speaks on behalf of the defendant.  

Court orders:   14CF231 - Total  12 years.   5 yrs  incarceration     7 yrs.    extended supervision.  Eligible for CIP & SAP.  DNA sample & surcharge.  ES conditions:  CC.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. No contact with victims or co-defendant.  Obtain  HSED, GED or equivalent.  AODA.  S/M employment.  Commensurate with treatment and counseling needs.  Agent to determine how much is appropriate.  Credit for 242 days.  

14CF220.  Probation 2 years.  concurrent.  same conditions as ES in 14CF231.  CC.  Credit for 242 days.  If sentence hinders treatment and counseling in 14CF231, this case can be brought back before the court to adjust sentence.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Hammer.  Information filed with Court.  Court recited charges and possible penalties on the same.  Defendant understands.  Court granted motion to amend the information.  Defendant plead guilty to the charges in the amended information.  Defendant reviewed the plea questionnaire and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understands.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.  Court found that the defendant entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Joint recommendation for 2yr probation, concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Get GED or HSED.  No contact with Caleb Rave.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Attorney Hammer requests that the sentencing be held with 14CF231.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Det. K.B. to appear at jury trial scheduled for July 9-10, 2015.
Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel Russell Hammer.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Jury trial is still on.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Furlough request granted.
Cheryl Sisco court reporter.  ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Hammer appeared in court.  Case not resolved.  Set for 1 day jury trial.

Pre-trial conference at 02-25-2015 09:00 am.
Status conference at 03-09-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant apeared in custody in person with attorney Russell Hammer.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Information filed on 14CF231.  Waived reading of Information and stood mute.  Court entered NGP on both cases and set pretrial for 2-25-15 and status conference for 3-9-15 at 3:00 on both 14CF220 and 14CF231.  Bond continued.
Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Russell Hammer.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Probable cause found and bound over for trial.  Information to be filed.  Arraignment to be set.
and certificate of appearance served on Kelly Bakken to appear at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing on January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
DA Fox appears on behalf of the State.  Defendant appears by video from the jail.  Attorney Hammer appeared in person.  Reading of complaint waived.  Preliminary hearing requested.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail.  William Poss, SPD appeared specially.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant states he applied for SPD.  Per Poss, local office has a conflict so still working on assigning attorney.  Set return date.
Initial appearance on December 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Defendant has not contacted SPD yet.  AIA set for 12/22.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail without counsel.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Cash bond ordered with conditions.  Return date given.
Initial appearance on December 15, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Caleb R. or his family.   Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin. Keep Court informed of any address change.
cancel per SO a.m. sheet; custody JASO
